title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: How are you doing?
answer_text: I’m well.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You say the Constitution is clear about your obligation and the Senate’s to consider a nominee to the Court. Vice President Biden, you say that this is an effort by the President and Republicans to jam through on an appointment in what you call an abuse of power. My first question to both of you tonight, why are you right in the argument you make and your opponent wrong?
answer_text: And where do you think a Justice Barrett would take the court? President Trump, in this first segment, you go first. Two minutes.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: And, by the way, the 200,000 people that have died on his watch, how many of those have survived? Well, there’s seven million people that contracted COVID. What does it mean for them going forward if you strike down the Affordable Care Act?
answer_text: Joe, you’ve had 308,000 military people dying because you couldn’t provide them proper healthcare in the military. So don’t tell me about this.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You don’t know what’s on the ballot. Why is it on the ballot? Why is it on the ballot?
answer_text: It’s not on the ballot.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You, in the course of these four years, have never come up with a comprehensive plan to replace Obamacare, and just this last Thursday you signed a largely symbolic Executive Order to protect people with pre-existing conditions five days before this debate. So my question, sir, is what is the Trump healthcare plan?
answer_text: Well, first of all, I guess I’m debating you, not him, but that’s okay. I’m not surprised. Let me just tell you something.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What about pre-existing conditions?
answer_text: All of the things that we’ve done.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Are you saying you didn’t agree?
answer_text: I’m not going to listen to him. The fact of the matter is I beat Bernie Sanders.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: With what?
answer_text: And tonight I’m going to make sure.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: With what?
answer_text: Because here’s the deal, here’s the deal. The fact is that everything he’s saying so far is simply a lie. I’m not here to call out his lies.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Mr. President, can you let him finish, sir?
answer_text: No, he doesn’t know how to do that.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Who is, Bernie?
answer_text: Because he, in fact, already has cost 10 million people their healthcare that they had from their employers because of his recession. Number one. Number two, there are 20 million people getting healthcare through Obamacare now that he wants to take it away.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: We guaranteed pre-existing conditions, but took away the individual mandate. Listen, this is the way it is. And that destroyed … They shouldn’t even call it Obamacare, then I had a choice to make, do I let my people run it really well or badly?
answer_text: If I run it badly, they’ll probably blame him, but they’ll blame me. But more importantly, I want to help people. Okay.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: But, in fact, it wasn’t brought up by the President. It was brought up by some of your Democratic colleagues in the Congress. So my question to you is, you have refused in the past to talk about it, are you willing to tell the American people tonight whether or not you will support either ending the filibuster or packing the court?
answer_text: Whatever position I take on that, that’ll become the issue. The issue is the American people should speak. You should go out and vote.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Are you going to pack the court?
answer_text: Vote now.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Are you going to pack the court?
answer_text: Make sure you, in fact, let people know, your Senators.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Listen, who is on your list, Joe? Who’s on your list?
answer_text: Gentlemen, I think we’ve ended this-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: In addition to that, what did he do?
answer_text: He went in and we were insisting that the people we had in the ground in China should be able to go to Wuhan and determine for themselves how dangerous this was. He did not even ask Xi to do that.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: He told us what a great job Xi was doing. He said we owe him a debt of gratitude for being so transparent with us. And what did he do then?
answer_text: He then did nothing. He waited and waited and waited. He still doesn’t have a plan.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: How many of you got up this morning and had an empty chair at the kitchen table because someone died of COVID? How many of you are in a situation where you lost your mom or dad and you couldn’t even speak to them, you had a nurse holding a phone up so you could in fact say goodbye?
answer_text: We would have lost far more people, far more people. You would have been months late. You’re months behind me, Joe.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You don’t trust Johnson & Johnson, Pfizer?
answer_text: Okay, gentlemen, gentlemen. Let me move on to questions about the future because you both have touched on two of the questions I’m going to ask. Focusing on the future first, President Trump, you have repeatedly either contradicted or been at odds with some of your governments own top scientists.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Are they both wrong?
answer_text: Well, I’ve spoken to the companies and we can have it a lot sooner. It’s a very political thing because people like this would rather make it political than save lives.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Your running mate, Senator Harris, goes further, saying that public health experts quote, “Will be muzzled, will be suppressed.” Given the fact that polls already show that people are concerned about the vaccine and are reluctant to take it, are you and your running mate, Senator Harris, contributing to that fear?
answer_text: No more than the question you just asked him. You pointed out he puts pressure and disagrees with his own scientists.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: He panicked or he just looked at the stock market. One of the two. Because guess what?
answer_text: A lot of people died and a lot more are going to die unless he gets a lot smarter, a lot quicker-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Did you use the word smart? So you said you went to Delaware State, but you forgot the name of your college. You didn’t go to Delaware State.
answer_text: You graduated either the lowest or almost the lowest in your class. Don’t ever use the word smart with me. Don’t ever use that word.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Reopenings. Vice President Biden, you have been much more reluctant than President Trump about reopening the economy and schools. Why, sir?
answer_text: Because he doesn’t have a plan. If I were running it, I’d know what the plan is. You’ve got to provide these businesses the ability to have the money to be able to reopen with the PPE, as well as with the sanitation they need.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Will he just shush for a minute?
answer_text: Tell that to Nancy Pelosi, and Schumer [crosstalk] Chuck.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What about this question of reopenings and the fact-
answer_text: Well, he wants to shut down this country and I want to keep it open, and we did a great thing by shutting it down-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: President Trump, you have begun to increasingly question the effectiveness of masks as a disease preventer. And in fact, recently you have cited the issue of waiters touching their masks and touching plates. Are you questioning the efficacy of masks?
answer_text: No, I think masks are okay. You have to understand, if you look… I mean, I have a mask right here. I put a mask on when I think I need it.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: All right. In any case, why you holding the big rallies? Why you not?
answer_text: You go first, sir.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: But are not worried about us spreading disease?
answer_text: … I’ve done a great job as a president, and I’ll have 25, 35,000 people show up at airports. We use airports and hangers and we have a lot of people-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Are you not worried about the disease issues, sir?
answer_text: Well, so far we have had no problem whatsoever. It’s outside. That’s a big difference according to the experts.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Gentlemen, can we move on to the economy?
answer_text: Yes.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: President Trump, you say we are in a V-shaped recovery. Vice President Biden, you say it’s more of a K-shape. What difference does that mean to the American people in terms of the economy?
answer_text: President Trump, in this segment you go first.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Should have never happened from China. But what happened is we closed it down and now we’re reopening and we’re doing record business. We had 10.4 million people in a four-month period that we’ve put back into the workforce.
answer_text: That’s a record the likes of which nobody’s ever seen before. And he wants to close down the… He will shut it down again. He will destroy this country.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: A lot of people, between drugs and alcohol and depression, when you start shutting it down, you take a look at what’s happening at some of your Democrat-run states where they have these tough shutdowns. And I’m telling you it’s because they don’t want to open it. One of them came out last week, you saw that, “Oh, we’re going to open up on November 9th.” Why November 9th?
answer_text: Because it’s after the election. They think they’re hurting us by keeping them closed. They’re hurting people.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: When you look at North Carolina, when you look, and these governors are under siege, Pennsylvania, Michigan, and a couple of others, you got to open these states up. It’s not fair. You’re talking about almost it’s like being in prison.
answer_text: And you look at what’s going on with divorce, look at what’s going on with alcoholism and drugs. It’s a very, very sad thing. And he’ll close down the whole country.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: The difference is millionaires and billionaires like him in the middle of the COVID crisis have done very well. Billionaires have made another $300 billion because of his profligate tax proposal, and he only focused on the market. But you folks at home, you folks living in Scranton and Claymont and all the small towns and working class towns in America, how well are you doing?
answer_text: This guy paid a total of $750 in taxes.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Do I get my time back? The fact is that he has in fact, worked on this in a way that he’s going to be the first president of the United States to leave office, having fewer jobs in his administration than when he became president. Fewer jobs than when he became president.
answer_text: First one in American history.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Is it true that you paid $750 in federal income taxes each of those two years?
answer_text: I paid millions of dollars in taxes, millions of dollars of income tax. And let me just tell you, there was a story in one of the papers that paid-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: No, Mr. President, I’m asking you a question. Will you tell us how much you paid in federal income taxes in 2016 and 2017?
answer_text: Millions of dollars.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: So not 750?
answer_text: Millions of dollars. And you’ll get to see it. And you’ll get to see it.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: When?
answer_text: But let me just tell you-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: In [crosstalk]?
answer_text: Chris, let me just say something, that it was the tax laws. I don’t want to pay tax. Before I came here, I was a private developer, I was a private business people.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Vice President Biden, you want to respond?
answer_text: Yeah, I do want to respond. Look, the tax code that put him in a position that he pays less tax than on the money a school teacher makes is because of him… He says he’s smart because he can take advantage of the tax code. And he does take advantage of the tax code.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: But why didn’t you do it over the last 25 years?
answer_text: Because you weren’t president-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Why didn’t you do it over the last 25 years?
answer_text: Because you weren’t president and screwing things up.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Okay. Gentlemen?
answer_text: Including fixing the broken military that you gave me, including taking care of your debts.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Why didn’t you do it before, when you were Vice-President with Obama?
answer_text: Because you in fact passed that, that was your tax proposal.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: I got it done. And you know what happened?
answer_text: Yeah, you got it done-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Mr. President, let me pick up on that. You would continue your free market approach, lower taxes, more deregulation, correct?
answer_text: Not lower tax for the American people.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: When COVID came along.
answer_text: … when there was record low unemployment before COVID.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: He makes millions of dollars. And also, while we’re at it, why is it just out of curiosity, the mayor of Moscow’s wife gave your son three and a half million dollars?
answer_text: That is not true.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What did he do to deserve it? What did he do with Burisma-
answer_text: None of that is true.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: … to deserve $183,000?
answer_text: Sir, you’ve asked him a question, let him answer it.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Oh really, he didn’t get three and a half million?
answer_text: Mr. President-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Well wait, he didn’t get three and a half million dollars, Joe?
answer_text: Mr. Vice-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Oh, really?
answer_text: Mr. President, it’s an open discussion. Please- [crosstalk]

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Did Burisma pay him 183 thousand a month, with no experience in energy?
answer_text: Mr. President-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: By who?
answer_text: And you can-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Oh, really?
answer_text: I did it honorably.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Why did he deserve three and a half million from Moscow?
answer_text: Look, here’s the deal. We want to talk about families and ethics. I don’t want to do that.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: … second point I’d make to you, is that when Floyd was killed, when Mr. Floyd was killed, there was a peaceful protest in front of the White House. What did he do?
answer_text: He came out of his bunker, had the military use tear gas on them so he could walk across to a church and hold up a Bible. And then what happened after that? The Bishop of that very church said that it was a disgrace.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: One in 500 African Americans. This man, this man is a savior of African-Americans? This man cares at all?
answer_text: This man’s done virtually nothing. Look, the fact is that you have to look at what he’s talks about. You have to look at what he did.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: President Trump, you have two minutes. Why should Americans trust you over your opponent to deal with race issues?
answer_text: You did a crime bill, 1994, where you called them super-predators. African-Americans are super- predators and they’ve never forgotten it. They’ve never forgotten it.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: And why aren’t you saying those words, Joe? Why don’t you say the words law enforcement? Because you know what?
answer_text: If they called us in Portland, we would put out that fire in a half an hour. But they won’t do it, because they’re run by radical left Democrats. If you look at Chicago, if you look at any place you want to look, Seattle, they heard we were coming in the following day and they put up their hands and we got back Seattle.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: All right. I want to return to the question of race. Vice President Biden, after the grand jury in the Breonna Taylor case decided not to charge any of the police with homicide, you said it raises the question, “Whether justice could be equally applied in America.” Do you believe that there is a separate but unequal system of justice for Blacks in this country?
answer_text: Yes, there is. There’s systemic injustice in this country, in education and work and in law enforcement and the way in which it’s enforced. But look, the vast majority of police officers are good, decent, honorable men and women.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What is peaceful protest? When they run through the middle of the town-
answer_text: President Trump-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: This month, your Administration, uh, directed federal agencies to end racial sensitivity training that addresses white privilege or critical race theory. Why did you decide to do that, to end racial sensitivity training? And do you believe that there is systemic racism in this country, sir?
answer_text: I ended it because it’s racist. I ended it because a lot of people were complaining that they were asked to do things that were absolutely insane. That it was a radical revolution that was taking place in our military, in our schools, all over the place.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What is radical about racial sensitivity training?
answer_text: If you were a certain person, you had no status in life. It was sort of a reversal. And if you look at the people, we would pay people hundreds of thousands of dollars to teach very bad ideas and frankly, very sick ideas.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Are you in favor of law and order?
answer_text: I’m in favor of law. You follow a little bit of order- [crosstalk].

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: So the question is, is this really a party issue?
answer_text: I think it’s a party issue. You can bring in a couple of examples but if you look at Chicago, what’s going on in Chicago where, uh, 53 people were shot and eight died. Shot.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: I do want to talk about this issue of law and order though. And in the joint recommendation that came from the Biden-Bernie Sanders task force, you talked about quote re-imagining policing. First of all, what does re-imagining policing mean and do you support?
answer_text: It means. . .

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: . . . If I might finish the question, what does re-imagining policing mean and do you support the Black Lives Matter call uh, for uh, community control of policing?
answer_text: Look, what I support is the police having the opportunity to deal with the problems they face and I’m totally opposed to defunding the police offices. As a matter of fact police, local police, the only one defunding, in his budget calls for a $400 million cut in local law enforcement assistance. They need more assistance.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Oh really? Oh really?
answer_text: Let, let’s just. . .

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Who?
answer_text: I think it–Kellyanne Conway.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You mean, I have to answer his stuff?
answer_text: You have repeatedly…

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: His statement?
answer_text: You have repeatedly. . . No. . .

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: So what are you, what are you saying?
answer_text: I’m willing to do anything. I want to see peace.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Well, your, your side agreed to it, and why don’t you observe what your campaign agreed to as a ground rule. Okay, sir?
answer_text: He never keeps his word.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Can I answer. . .
answer_text: No! That was a rhetorical question.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Can you add back 30 seconds?
answer_text: Yes. You may have,

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Really?
answer_text: And I resent-

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: I’m talking about my son, Beau Biden, you’re talking about Hunter?
answer_text: I don’t know Beau. I know Hunter. Hunter got thrown out of the military.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: But why was he given tens of millions of dollars?
answer_text: Alright. . .

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: He was given tens of millions of dollars?
answer_text: That was totally discredited.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Why did he get it?
answer_text: Mitt Romney on that committee said it wasn’t worth taxpayer’s money. That report was written for political reason.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You have rolled back a number of Obama Environmental records, what do you believe about the science of climate change, and what will you do in the next four years to confront it?
answer_text: I want crystal clean water and air. I want beautiful clean air. We have now the lowest carbon.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What do you believe about the science of climate change, sir?
answer_text: I believe that we have to do everything we can to have immaculate air, immaculate water, and do whatever else we can that’s good. You know, we’re planting a billion trees–the Billion Tree Project–and it’s very exciting for a lot of people.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You believe that human pollution, gas, greenhouse gas emissions contributes to the global warming of this planet?
answer_text: I think a lot of things do, but I think to an extent, yes. I think to an extent, yes. But I also think we have to do better management of our forests.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: But sir, if you believe in the science of climate change, why have you rolled back the Obama Clean Power Plan which limited carbon emissions in power plants? Why have you relaxed…?
answer_text: Because it was driving energy prices through the sky.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Why have you relaxed fuel economy standards that are going to create more pollution from cars and trucks?
answer_text: Well, not really because what’s happening is the car is much less expensive, and it’s a much safer car, and you’re talking about a tiny difference. And then what would happen because of the cost of the car you would have at least double and triple the number of cars purchased. We have the old slugs out there that are 10, 12 years old.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What about, what about the argument that President Trump basically says, that you have to balance environmental interests and economic interests? And he’s drawn his line.
answer_text: Well, he hadn’t drawn a line. He still, for example, makes sure that we, he wants to make sure that methane’s not a problem. We can, you, you can now emit more methane without it being a problem.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Where they want to rip down buildings. . .
answer_text: [to Biden] Let him go for a minute, and then you can go.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You know, that’s not true either, right?
answer_text: Not true.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What it’s going to do, it’s going to create thousands and millions of jobs. Good paying jobs.
answer_text: Hundred trillion dollars.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: For 47?
answer_text: So why didn’t you get the world—China sends up real dirt into the air. Russia does. India does.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What he did is he said. . .
answer_text: Okay, we’re going to get into a new segment. Mr. Vice President, Mr.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Do you support the . . .
answer_text: No, I don’t support the Green New Deal.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You just lost the radical left. It’s done. Oh you don’t?
answer_text: I support the Biden plan that I put forward.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: All right, gentlemen, final segment: Election integrity. As we meet tonight, millions of Americans are receiving mail-in ballots or going to vote early. How confident should we be that this will be a fair election, and what are you prepared to do over the next five plus weeks?
answer_text: Because it will not only be to election day, but also counting some ballots–mail-in ballots–after election day. What are you prepared to do to reassure the American people that the next president will be the legitimate winner of this election. In this final segment, Mr.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: So vote. Just make sure you understand, you have it in your control to determine what this country is gonna look like the next four years. Is it going to change, or are you going to get four more years of these lies?
answer_text: Mr. President, two minutes.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: And are you counting on the Supreme Court, including a Justice Barrett, to settle any dispute?
answer_text: Yeah. I think I’m counting on them to look at the ballots, definitely. I don’t think—I hope we don’t need them, in terms of the election itself.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What you do is you go and vote. You do a solicited ballot, and that’s okay. . .
answer_text: No. No. I know your complaint.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You either do, Chris, a solicited ballot, where you’re sending it in, they’re sending it back and you’re sending. They have mailmen with lots of it. Did you see what’s going on?
answer_text: Take a look at West Virginia, mailman selling the ballots. They’re being sold. They’re being dumped in rivers.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: . . .or they missed the deadline. So the question I have is, are you concerned that the Supreme Court with a Justice Barrett will settle any dispute?
answer_text: I am concerned that any court would settle this, because here’s the deal. When you file—when you get a ballot and you fill it out, you’re supposed to have an affidavit. If you didn’t know, you have someone say that, this is me.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Could be months.
answer_text: . . . until we find out who the new president is. So, I–first for you, sir. Finally, for the Vice- President, and I hope neither of you will interrupt the other.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: You’re urging them what?
answer_text: . . . I am 100% on board. But if I see tens of thousands of ballots being manipulated, I can’t go along with that.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: What does that mean, not go along. . .
answer_text: . .. from a common sense. . .

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: … to take to the streets?
answer_text: It means you have a fraudulent election. You’re sending out 80 million ballots. . .

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: And what would you do about that?
answer_text: They’re not equipped. These people aren’t equipped to handle it, number one. Number two, they cheat.

title: CPD_ September 29, 2020 Debate Transcript
question_text: Vice President Biden, final question for you. Will you urge your supporters to stay calm while the vote is counted? And will you pledge not to declare victory until the election is independently certified?
answer_text: Yes. And here’s the deal. We count the ballots, as you pointed out.
